This works for me on my GTK box using the date from the log file. Can you tell me what projects you were comparing? Also, what is the local of your GTK box?

In this particular case, we could get away without using ICU4J for the CVS date tag parsing since CVS doesn;t support different date formats. However, it would be worthwhile finding out why this fails for ICU4J.

user.country=US
user.language=en
user.timezone=Europe/Zurich

But AFAIK the date format can be adjusted beyond the locale.

A project which makes it fail is for example "org.eclipse.jdt.ui".

Created an attachment (id=40267)
Date format patch

Here is a patch that reverts the cvs core classes that don't outwardly display any dates to use the java date formatting util.
This is fine. ICU4J is not adding any value here because the server is speaking a fixed pattern that is supported by the base classes. +1
